chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Socha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waushara County Clerk of Courts Office

miscConds.notes: Court orders restitution to be paid in increments of no less than $100.00 per month commencing December 1, 2015.  In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with D. Schmidt as named in the complaint.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Court does not object to jurisdiction of supervision under interstate compact.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No. 2015CF000066

superMiscConds.notes: The Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the victim as named in the Complaint, D. Schmidt.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

The remaining balance of the Restitution in the amount of $563.00 is reimposed.  The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.    In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Court reimposed to the extent not previously paid in the amount of $556.23.  The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment of court costs.  Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days of relesae or re-establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 14CF-160 and 15CF-66 - Both Cases Called @ 11:05 AM: Defendant Justin J. Socha in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel admit receipt of Rev Order and Warrant.  Counsel stipulated to TS credit.  Counsel believe that absent being mention in Rev Packet - concurrent SEH to be imposed.  15CF-66 Chapter 950 in compliance.  Based upon significant efforts made by the State to contact victim - Chapter 950 compliance does in fact exist and also as to 14CF-160.  Argument by DA Blader as to SEH.  Argument by SPD Szilagyi SEH.  Statement by Def: Yes prepared written statement read.  The Court:  14CF-160:  3 yr bifurcated SEH - 1 yrs IC/2 yrs ES.  248 days TS credit.  15CF-66:  7 yr bifurcated SEH.  3 yrs IC/4 yrs ES.  244 days TS credit.   Conditions of ES:  Complete SOT, N/C with any females under 18 yrs unless in the immediate company of parent or guardian;   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Rest that remains owing as to 14CF-160 - DOC is authorized to collect from inmate earnings in a reasonable amount percentage as determined by DOC; unclear if Rest remains owing as to 15CF-66.  SOR to continue as previously ordered; No Contact with 15CF-66 victim V.P.; Costs reimposed.  Court believes Def is ineligible for both SAP/CIP due to charge.  If not statutorily ineligible for SAP and CIP, the Court would authorize entry into those programs if the Department finds it appropriate, Court will allow entry into same.  Appeal Rights Given.
Character letter from J. Woodhill
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 11, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Released from jail-contempt, 90 days to serve-stayed. Must pay $100/month starting May 1, 2017

records.addlTxt: 3:34 pm case called. Defendant Justin J. Socha in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Defendant Justin J. Socha in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record by ADA Anderson. Statement by Attorney Rashid.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright the repeater enhancer on Count 1 and dismisses and reads-in Count 2. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. Concurrent to any other sentence. CONDITIONS: 184 days WCJ, Credit for 184 days served. Restitution in the amount of $882.25 to D. Schmidt, to be paid in increments of no less than $100 per month commencing December 1, 2015. No Contact with D. Schmidt.   Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Extradition costs of $400. Court does not object to jurisdiction of superision under the interstate compact. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-17-2015 02:45 pm
from Atty Rashid requesting adjournment - Granted by the court
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-01-2015 02:45 pm

11:47 am case called. Defendant Justin J. Socha in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding preliminary hearing. Attorney Rashid states the defendant will be waiving the preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant regarding waiver. Defendant confirms waiver. Court accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court has read the criminal complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Rashid confirms receipt, waives formal reading. Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty. Court sets matter for plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Case called @ 11:10 a.m. Defendant Justin J. Socha in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson is requesting that bond not be ordered. Atty Szilagyi offers no position on bond. Court orders $10000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
